title: Trade Commodities
description: There are five different categories of Commodities: Food, Lumber, Luxuries, Ore, and Stone. When you Trade Commodities, select one Commodity that your kingdom currently stockpiles and reduce that Commodity’s stockpile by up to 4. Then attempt a basic check. If you trade with a group that you’ve established diplomatic relations with, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the check.

modifiers.name: Trading with a group with established diplomatic relationships
modifiers.buttonLabel: +1 Circumstance to trade with a group with established diplomatic relationships

criticalSuccess.msg: <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-dice" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="true" data-value="2">Gain 2 Resource Dice Next Turn</button> per point of stockpile expended from your Commodity now.

success.msg: <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-dice" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="true" data-value="1">Gain 1 Resource Dice Next Turn</button> per point of stockpile expended from your Commodity now.

failure.msg: <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-dice" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Resource Dice Next Turn</button>

criticalFailure.msg: You gain no bonus Resource Dice (though the Commodity remains depleted). If you Traded Commodities the previous turn, <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Unrest</button>
